reviewText: Awesome. Eddie was a credit to Hawaii inal he did for Hawaii.
The culture in this story is awesome. Eddie was truly a very kind young man.

Eddie Aikau should be a household name because of all the hundreds of people's lives he saves who were literally in over their heads in the waters of Hawaii.  A great humanitarian to the end when Eddie attempted to find help for the stranded Hokule'a.  Follows the book printed by BESS Press very well
Excellent
Great historic film of one of Hawaii's most beloved surfers.
beautiful. anyone with old memories of hawaii will love this film....and remember.

The best message related to Eddie's life is:  He was not a hero because he excelled at a sport; he was a "hero" because he was willing to take an incredible risk on behalf of others.  "Eddie would go."

I first saw this film  on PBS and couldn't wait for until it was released on DVD.  After reading several books and hearing stories
it was a pleasure to view something about the man, the surfer and ultimately the humanitarian who was ready to sacrifice
himself for his people and his culture. So much Aloha.

This is one of the top five surf documentaries.  Poignant, with details of his final days.  Details of his impact on others who knew him.  I remember a Discovery Channel docu of people who almost lost their life.  A 60-something Caucasian tells the story of Akai saving his life when he waded too far out, back in late 60's.  He one of many who owed his life to Lifeguard job of Akai at Waimea Bay, Oahu.  Special Features also with Rabbit Bartholemew.
great movie about a great hawaiian legend
Beautiful moving movies aloha
Great movie and very moving story.
A fitting tribute to a Hawaiian legend and symbol of Aloha.
Fantastic film. I get emotional watching this movie, it's very well directed and fills me with pride to be Hawaiian.
Very pleased!!!..5 stars!!!!!
AWESOME AND VERY EDUCATIONAL, SUCH A GOOD STORY
Great video!
GREAT HAWAIIAN HISTORY!

This is a hidden gem of a documentary that teaches you a great deal about racism in Hawaii in early 1900s against its own sovereign people. The story of Eddie Aicau expresses the beauty and values of a great people. It's a true story, even more meticulously researched by ESPN. Buy this.
Compelling 90 minutes.  Great scenes, history and story.
Amazing story of personal triumph,  rising above what is expected of you, raking pride in who you are and where you come from. A must see for any surfer or non surfer.
Best documentary on Eddie Aikau I ever seen! If you love surfing and  the history of surfing this is a must see!
Great product and seller.
great
Eddie Aikau Our Hawaiian Hero, Hawaiian Super Man!!!!!!

This is a great film!  If you have ever wondered what "Eddie Would Go" means, this film will explain it all.  It is all about Eddie's life, his family, the surfing community and includes wonderful actual footage of him surfing.  I loved it and would recommend it to any age and especially inspiring for youngsters.
interesting for someone who likes surfing and Hawaiian history/culture
Outstanding
Everything is as expected. No complaints!

In Jr. & Sr. High School in Southern California surfing was all the rage...even among non-surfers.  You knew all about it from your surfing-culture classmates. The attire. Some trying to make surfboards in woodshop.  So why is it I never heard of Eddie Aikau?  I knew about Endless Summer and various board manufacturers like Hobie, and guys like The Bull. Interesting story...and tragic.
Was on vacation in Hawaii recently when I first came across Eddie's story.  Have been following his legacy since then - very inspirational story.
love this little bit of history... and Eddie's story.  Bought for my daughters report on him.
could have been better with less talking more surfing
awesome movie, life of a true hawaiian
Good insight into Eddie and his world.

I went to Waimea years ago and bought a pair of board shorts in the store at Halaeiva. There was a patch sewn onto the shorts commemorating Eddie Aikau, so I asked the Lifeguard about him but always wondered about the truth of the story. Such a great video and a must for all surf fans. RIP Eddie, wherever you are !
Loved - wonderful story
loved it
Great film about a great Hawaiian.  Lots of good interviews.  Give a bit more insight to Eddie and his life. What a wonderful man we lost too soon.
